alert.note: Alert for Ashtabula Inland; Ashtabula Lakeshore; Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:14AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Trumbull and Ashtabula Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 514 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Painesville to near Mantua to near Ravenna. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Warren, Ashtabula, Conneaut, Geneva-On-The-Lake, Niles, Hubbard, Cortland, Geneva, Newton Falls, Lordstown, North Kingsville, Kinsman, North Bloomfield, Orwell, Andover, West Farmington, Vienna Center, Hilltop, Maplewood Park and Bristolville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM EDT for northeastern Ohio.
